page.title: 03RADFORD PARK
page.content: Radford Park is the largest {recreational}area in Plymstock. Once the Radford Estate, there are still ruins of the old boat-house and the seventeenth century lodge keeper's house in the{parkland}near the lake. There are many improvements being made around the lake: streams have been bridged, paths covered by stone chippings,a wide variety of trees planted, nesting sites for {wildlife}created and wooden benches provided. This work currently being undertaken by young unemployed teenagers as part of a{government training scheme}aims to make the park a centre for{leisure and education. By combining attractive landscape, varied wildlife habitats and public access the{Radford Project will improve recreational facilities.
